STEP 2 - EVIDENCE-BASED TREATMENT SELECTION: Now I'll select treatments based on current clinical guidelines. - First-line treatment per guidelines: Surgical excision with appropriate margins, followed by histopathological diagnosis and staging. - Supporting evidence: Wide local excision is standard for soft tissue sarcomas to ensure complete removal; adjunct therapies depend on stage. - Patient-specific considerations: Anxiety may predispose to increased concern; precise communication vital. - Contraindications or cautions: Avoid biopsy delay; ensure imaging prior to definitive surgery for planning. STEP 4 - NON-PHARMACOLOGICAL INTERVENTIONS: I'll include lifestyle and behavioral interventions. - Primary non-drug interventions: Avoid pressure or trauma to the lesion; activity modification to prevent discomfort. - Patient education priorities: Understanding the benign vs. malignant importance; importance of timely diagnosis. - Lifestyle modifications: Maintain normal activity levels unless contraindicated post-surgery. - Behavioral interventions: Address anxiety with reassurance; consider referral for counseling if anxiety impairs decision-making.  STEP 5 - MONITORING & FOLLOW-UP STRATEGY: Establish appropriate follow-up. - Follow-up timeline: Schedule biopsy results and surgical consultation within 1-2 weeks. - Monitoring parameters: Symptom progression, signs of hemorrhage, infection, or recurrence. - Red flag symptoms: Increasing pain, rapid growth, neurovascular compromise, systemic symptoms. - Treatment response assessment: Pathology report post-biopsy; post-surgical margins; presence of residual disease.
